title.narrative: F.a: Empowering adolescents and young women to enjoy their sexual and reproductive health and rights and be free from violence

description.narrative: Women and girls face significant gender inequalities, discrimination and even violence. Social and cultural norms reinforce gender roles and are contributing factors to decreasing women’s active agency as decision makers, leaders, income earners, and con sequently impact their right to reproduction, safety from violence, and rights to resources and opportunities. There are very few social support systems and services available. Adolescents, especially adolescent girls, are an often overlooked and under-ser ved population group in interventions. Plan will implement the project in 20 communities in Nyaung?U Township in Mandalay Region, where Plan has been working since 2015. The project is utilizing a four-pronged approach to improve girls’ knowledge and ca pacities in making informed decisions, addressing the social environment regarding gender equality, working with local civil society to create momentum for the realization of girls’ rights, and working with government across various levels for influencin g. Global Champions of Change curriculum will be adapted for the country context to be followed by a training of trainers and ongoing mentoring for facilitators. Peer-to-peer networks will be established in 20 communities and supported with social empowerm ent fund to implement youth-led campaigns to claim their SRHR. Village Development Committees?will be?strengthened to tackle harmful norms and promote behaviours that value girls equally. Participation of women, PWDs, adolescents and youth?will be?strength ened,?and?training related to financial management?organized.?Revolving funds?are?provided to 20 target villages as incentives for them to engage in reinforcing positive norms and tackling harmful practices.?Plan?will facilitate community groups in designi ng and implementing awareness campaigns designed to increase investment in girls and to tackle harmful social norms. In order to address duty-bearers to place adolescent’s SRHR on higher priority in policy frameworks and budgets and to deliver quality SR H services, contributions will be made to the Ministry of Health in terms of supporting implementation of the SRHR Policy and National Youth Policy; organizing meetings with the government to identify entry points to support policy implementation and estab lishing a coalition with likeminded CSO partners, working groups and media stakeholders at both regional and national levels.
